_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Scott Medical Products/Airgas Specialty gases Fluorine Building operates an Industrial Gas distribution and storage facility for Fluorine and Sulfur Tetrafluoride. 



The toxic characteristics of Fluorine and Sulfur Tetrafluoride make it necessary to observe certain precautions when handling. 



Overall, the prevention of exposures and reducing the threat to associates personal health, as well as reducing the threat to nearby members of the community is the main goal of incorporating this Risk Management Plan into our daily operations. 



It is Scott Medical Products/Airgas Specialty Gases policy to adhere to all applicable local, state, and federal rules and regulations. 



Overall safety of the facility depends upon the manner in which products are stored and handled, combined in coordination with the operations and maintenance procedures provided to all personnel responsible for the use of the systems. 



Written policies and procedures for handling these products are followed each day. Maintenance when necessary is performed by qualified Airgas personnel or contracted out to pre-qualified companies who have trained personnel in the proper maintenance of the systems. 



The mechanical integrity of the systems is maintained in accordance with all good engineering practices. 



Airgas maintenance personnel and contractors have access to the Operations & Maintenance manuals for all systems. 



This facility has a Process Safety Management plan which is incorporated into the daily routine to comply with the Level 3 Prevention Program requirements.



The facility follows the Airgas Health, Safety, and Environmental program that includes items such as Lockout/Tag out, Hazard Communication, Contractor Safety, etc. 



The facility has an Emergency Action Plan in place to aid in the response of accidental releases and natural disasters that may affect the facility.



The Bucks county LEPC and the Plumsteadville Fire Department have been provided copies of this

plan. If a release were to occur at this location, associates would be notified of the release by activation of the audible alarm and muster at the evacuation point for a head count and notify the Plumsteadville Fire Department if necessary. 



The Plumsteadville  Fire Department is the primary response agency to a release at this location and is trained in Hazardous Materials operations. 



The distance to the endpoint for the worst case scenario is 0.6 miles.



The area surrounding the facility is considered urban. 



This release scenario could impact approximately 1054 persons in a 0.6 mile radius. This information was determined using RMP*Comp and MARPLOT software. 



The distance to endpoint for the alternate release scenario is 0.3 miles.



This release scenario could impact approximately 6 persons in a 0.3 mile radius.



This information was determined using RMP*Comp and MARPLOT software.
